listing.description: Situated within its own private park, Queens House has been immaculately restored to create a family house of an outstanding standard.LocationQueens House is located within some of Hampshire's most beautiful countryside in gently rolling downland within the North Wessex Downs area, sitting on the edge of Outstanding Natural Beauty.Monk Sherborne is a thriving village with a local shop and public house. Road links are excellent with both the M3 and M4 for fast access to London and the West and the A34 providing a north-south link.The area is well known for its highly-regarded preparatory and public schools including Cheam, St Gabriels, Horris Hill, Daneshill, Farleigh, Ludgrove, Elstree, Downe House, Radley, Bradield, Wellington and Marlborough.Above all else Queens House is ideally placed to pursue any number of recreational activities offering numerous walks and bridleways throughout the surrounding countryside. Renowned riding school at Wellington which has an international reputation is nearby.There is a shooting school at Oakley and of course Hampshire is renowned for its many private shoots.The finest chalk stream rivers in the country are less that 30 miles away in the Test Valley.There are a number of excellent pubs and fine dining restaurants including the Wellington Arms at nearby Baughurst. Lovely country pubs with the Watership Down and The Jack Russell at Faccombe all within an easy drive. The superb Hampshire Four Seasons hotel and Heckfield Place also within easy reach.Being so well placed it is also easy to plan day visits to the New Forest and sailing on the South Coast.DescriptionSituated within its own private park, Queens House has been immaculately restored to create a family house of an outstanding standard.This Victorian character home boasts elegant reception rooms all with a south facing aspect, along with wonderful views over the mature gardens and park like setting.Particular attention has been given to ensuring the very best of family life and now includes a superb indoor swimming pool and spa complex with gymnasium, all featuring Sonos throughout, including the house and secondary accommodation.The principal reception rooms which all face south and lead off the large and impressive entrance hall. The drawing room has a double aspect and working fireplace.The study/library in common with all the other rooms on this floor has ceiling speakers and underfloor heating. The splendid dining room will comfortably seat 12 and can be approached both from the hall and kitchen with beautiful garden views.There is a spectacular family kitchen which leads onto a family room that measures over 40 feet with French doors onto a large terrace.This superb space has air conditioning and inbuilt sound plus AV system. The extensively fitted kitchen has been designed and installed by Smallbone with a beautiful gas fired Aga.The first floor features the main family accommodation including a spectacular principal bedroom suite with bathroom and dressing room, all the rooms on this floor have air conditioning.A second floor is brilliantly arranged either for children, a live in nanny or further spare guest accommodation with an ensuite fitted with Lefroy Brooks bathroom ware.Acreage: 13.23 AcresDirections• Heathrow Airport – 38 miles • Farnborough Airport – 21 miles• Train from Basingstoke to Clapham Junction – 38 minutes andWaterloo 45 minutes • Southampton Airport – 37 miles• Highclere Castle – 12.5 miles
listing.short_description: Situated within its own private park, Queens House has been immaculately restored to create a family house of an outstanding standard.

listing.description: Residential investment portfolio  This portfolio comprises 11 x 1 bed flats set within a courtyard "community" within easy striking distance of Basingstoke town centre with its array of shops and mainline station.Ample resident parking provided.The portfolio comprises:Bridge House - Built in 1934 and converted in 2019 to 3 flats.Bailey House – Purpose built, comprising 6 flats.Corner Flat – Purpose built, comprising 1 flat.The Wedge – Purpose built, comprising 1 flat.All properties have been let on Assured Shorthold Tenancy agreements, have an Electrical Installation Condition Report, Gas Safety Certificates (carried out by British Gas) and Energy Performance Certificate.The portfolio will be sold with the Freehold.All viewings are strictly by appointment.
listing.short_description: A unique investment opportunity, 11 x 1 bed properties with tenants in situ. Purchase this freehold portfolio with ample parking.
listing.displayable_address: Scotts Corner, The Harrow Way, Basingstoke RG22

listing.letting_fees:
Tenant charges

ASTs
Holding deposits (per tenancy) One week's rent (ASTs only)
Rent
Deposit (if rent is under £50,000 per annum) Equivalent to five week's rent
Deposit (if rent is between £50,000 and £100,000 per annum) Equivalent to six week's rent
Utilities, communication service, council tax and TV Licences
Variation of contract at the tenants request (£50 inclusive of VAT) (ASTs only)
Change of sharer at the tenant's request (£50 inclusive of VAT per replacement tenant or any reasonable costs incurred if higher) (ASTs only)
Early termination at the tenant's request - Should the tenant wish to leave their contract early, they shall be liable to the landlords costs in re-letting the property as well as all rent due under the tenancy until the start date of the replacement tenancy. These costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding on the tenancy. (ASTs only)
Unpaid rent/returned payments - Interest will be charged at 3% above the Bank of England Base Rate from rent due date until paid in order to pursue non-payment of rent. Please note: This will not be levied until the rent is more than 14 days in arrears.
Lost Keys or other security devices - Tenants are liable for the actual cost of replacing any lost keys or other security devices. If the loss results in locks needing to be changed, the actual cost of the locksmith, new lock and replacement keys will be charged to the tenant. If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £15 per hour (inclusive of VAT) for the time taken replacing the lost keys of other security devices.

Non ASTs
Before the tenancy starts:
Holding Deposit (Equivalent to two weeks' rent) (Non ASTs only)
Deposit (Equivalent to six week's rent (unless agreed otherwise)) (Non ASTs only)
Pet deposit (Equivalent to two week's rent in addition to your deposit (as listed above)) (Non ASTs only)
Tenancy Agreement fee (£276 inclusive of VAT) (Non ASTs only)
Reference fee payable by each tenant/guarantor (£48 inclusive of VAT) (Non ASTs only)
Permitted occupant check fee payable by each permitted occupier over the age of 18 (£24 inclusive of VAT) (Non ASTs only)
Bank reference fee (refer to your bank as charges vary) (Non ASTs only)
Stamp Duty (on tenancies that amount to over £125,000) (Non ASTs only)

During the tenancy:
Amendment fee for contract negotiation, amending terms and updating your tenancy agreement during your tenancy (£600 inclusive of VAT) (non ASTs only)
Utilities (gas, electricity, water and telephone)
Council Tax
Television licence
Installation of cable/satellite (if permitted and applicable)
Subscription to cable/satellite supplier
Insurance (for your personal and own contents)
Garden maintenance

Ending your tenancy:
Cleaning of the property
Inventory check-out (Non ASTs only)
Check out arrangement fee (£60 inclusive of VAT) (Non ASTs only)
Dilapidations (as agreed)

Other fees:
Unpaid rent/returned payments (Interest will be charged at 4% above the Bank of England Base Rate from the date due) (Non ASTs only)
Arrears letter charge (£24 per letter sent) (Non ASTs only)

Knight Frank are members of the Property Redress Scheme (Consumer Redress Scheme) and RICS Dispute Resolution Service (Business Redress Scheme) and have Client Money protection with RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.
listing.description: Little Manor Farm is a most attractive Grade II listed Georgian village house which dates from the early 19th century. The current owner has carried out an extensive and stylish restoration and remodelling of the house in recent years. The elegant and well-proportioned accommodation comprise a drawing room with bay window overlooking the garden, and a fireplace fitted with contemporary wood burning stove. The drawing room opens into the sitting/music area where there are fitted bookshelves. To the front of the house is the kitchen which is beautifully fitted with Harvey Jones bespoke units and Silestone worksurfaces and three oven Everhot range cooker. The kitchen opens into the dining room. There is also a study with fitted bookshelves. To the rear of the house and taking full advantage of the views over the garden is a Marston and Langinger garden room. From the reception hall there is access to the wine cellar.To the first floor there is a good size landing, with the main bedroom well-proportioned with a dressing room and bathroom. There are three further bedrooms and two further bathrooms, one of which is an en-suite.The Barn - Adjacent to the drive is the Grade II listed oak frame barn which is currently used as garaging, storage and workshop. The timber frame is exposed throughout, and subject to the necessary planning permissions, would be ideal for conversion into secondary accommodation or home office.Garden and grounds - From the village lane a five bar gate opens to the gravel drive which terminates in a parking and turning circle to the rear. The gardens lie principally to the rear of the house with areas of lawn. The garden opens out to the paddock within which is a vegetable patch and two stables. In all amounting to approximately 1.8 acres.Basingstoke 5 miles, Winchester 14 miles, M3 (Junction 7) 0.5 miles, London Waterloo via Basingstoke station from 47 minutes.Little Manor Farm is situated within a Conservation Area close to the centre of the attractive and much sought after village of Dummer. Within the village and walking distance of the house is the public house, church, village hall and golf club. The nearby village of North Waltham has an excellent local shop. Basingstoke with its extensive range of facilities is close by and the city of Winchester is within 14 miles to the south. Communications are first class with easy access to the M3 Junction 7 and regular rail service from Basingstoke station to London Waterloo. The schooling within the area is excellent, with primary schools in the neighbouring villages of North Waltham and Preston Candover and a broader range of independent schools including Princes Mead, Daneshill, Cheam, Farleigh, St Swithun's, Downe House and Winchester College. From the house there is easy access to the surrounding countryside, throughout which are many footpaths and bridleways.
listing.short_description: A most attractive Grade II listed Georgian farmhouse and barn situated in this sought after village.
listing.displayable_address: Down Street, Dummer, Basingstoke, Hampshire RG25

listing.description: Randalls Residential Estate Agents. Two excellent brand new detached family homes coming soon, located in the heart of the village. One for completion this September, the other for next January/February.Basingstoke 2 milesAlton 10 milesLondon Waterloo from 45 minutesSituationCliddesden is a popular village located just 2 miles to the south of Basingstoke. Within the village there is a traditional duck pond, a church, a thriving village hall, a popular pub and a highly regarded primary school, and a nursery school.Nearby Basingstoke offers a comprehensive range of leisure, educational and recreational facilities, and commuting is excellent with easy access to the M3 at junction 6 and to Basingstoke station (Waterloo from 45 minutes).The HousesThese two superb detached family homes are located close to the centre of the village and are traditionally built to an excellent specificationa.The Laurels (plot 1) will be completed in September. This offers spacious four bedroom accommodation extending to about 3422 sq.ft.Poppyfields (plot 2) will be completed in early 2022. This offers five bedroom accommocation extending to about 2962 sq.ft.Both properties will have grdens and double open-bay garages.All mains services will be available and both properties will have under-floor heating to the ground floors.The properties will be freehold and will have a 10 year warranty.Register now for further details. Call Randalls Residential on
listing.short_description: Randalls Residential Estate Agents. Two excellent brand new detached family homes coming soon, located in the heart of the village. One for completion this September, the other for next January/February.

listing.description: An attractive period detached farmhouse offering flexible family accommodation, which has been thoughtfully modernised and updated, whilst retaining many of its period features, including inglenook fireplaces, exposed timber framing and wooden latched doors. The ground floor features a wonderful drawing room with inglenook fireplace. The heart of the house is the lifestyle kitchen/dining/sitting room, offering wonderful entertaining space. Both the conservatory and study have double doors leading out to the terrace and garden beyond. The bedroom accommodation is arranged over two floors; comprising two en-suite bedrooms, three/four further bedrooms and a family bathroom. Ancillary accommodation is provided by a range of attractive outbuildings, including a gym, home office/potential annexe, double garage, covered parking area and greenhouse.The delightful rear gardens are private and secluded and enjoy fine views over the adjoining farmland. The gardens are mainly laid to lawn with well stocked flower and shrub beds and numerous mature shrubs and trees. There is a terrace area, ideal for al fresco dining, which leads onto the outbuildings and courtyard, with heated swimming pool.Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.Basingstoke 4 miles, Odiham 4.5 miles, M3 (J6) 3 miles, London Waterloo via Basingstoke station from 44 minutes (All distances & times are approximate)Webbs Farm House is situated in the centre of the popular village of Mapledurwell, surrounded by countryside. Within the village is a public house and church. Nearby Basingstoke provides more extensive facilities, with everyday shopping available in the villages of Old Basing, Odiham and Hook. State and independent schools nearby include Daneshill, Lord Wandsworth College and Cheam. Communications are first-class, with easy access to the M3(J5&6) and mainline stations to London Waterloo at both Basingstoke and Hook. Mapledurwell is surrounded by some of the finest countryside in this part of Hampshire.
listing.short_description: Beautiful Grade II listed period house overlooking farmland
listing.displayable_address: Tunworth Road, Mapledurwell, Basingstoke, Hampshire RG25

listing.description: Description:Your Move are delighted and excited to welcome this stunning block of five apartments to the market for sale as a fantastic investment opportunity.The current owner is looking to sell the freehold to The Watertower in Limes Park which consists of five apartments and the freehold of the block.The annual rental income at present collectively is £54,900.The apartments are as follows:2a - two bedroom apartment2b - one bedroom apartment2c - one bedroom apartment2d - one bedroom apartment2e - two bedroom apartmentLocation:The Watertower is located within Limes Park which is situated in the North of Basingstoke. The Watertower is close to local amenities, schools, parks and Basingstoke Hospital. Basingstoke is a great commuter location thanks to its easy access to the M3 and A303 motorways and direct train links to London in around 45 minutes.Auction Information:This property is for sale by the Modern Method of Auction. Should you view, offer or bid on the property, your information will be shared with the Auctioneer, iamsold.This method of auction requires both parties to complete the transaction within 56 days of the draft contract for sale being received by the buyers solicitor. This additional time allows buyers to proceed with mortgage finance (subject to lending criteria, affordability and survey).The buyer is required to sign a reservation agreement and make payment of a non-refundable Reservation Fee. This being 3% of the purchase price including VAT, subject to a minimum of £6,000.00 including VAT. The Reservation Fee is paid in addition to purchase price and will be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property in the calculation for stamp duty liability.Buyers will be required to go through an identification verification process with iamsold and provide proof of how the purchase would be funded.This property has a Buyer Information Pack which is a collection of documents in relation to the property. The documents may not tell you everything you need to know about the property, so you are required to complete your own due diligence before bidding. A sample copy of the Reservation Agreement and terms and conditions are also contained within this pack.The buyer will also make payment of £300.00 including VAT towards the preparation cost of the pack, where it has been provided by iamsold.The property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price with both the Reserve Price and Starting Bid being subject to change.Referral ArrangementsThe Partner Agent and Auctioneer may recommend the services of third parties to you. Whilst these services are recommended as it is believed they will be of benefit; you are under no obligation to use any of these services and you should always consider your options before services are accepted.Where services are accepted the Auctioneer or Partner Agent may receive payment for the recommendation and you will be informed of any referral arrangement and payment prior to any services being taken by you.Important note to purchasers:We endeavour to make our sales particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. Any services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All measurements have been taken as a guide to prospective buyers only, and are not precise. Please be advised that some of the particulars may be awaiting vendor approval. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller.BAS210097/2
listing.short_description: Your Move are delighted and excited to welcome this stunning block of five apartments to the market for sale as a fantastic investment opportunity.  The current owner is looking to sell the freehold to The Watertower in Limes Park (truncated)
listing.displayable_address: The Water Tower, Basingstoke, Hampshire RG24

listing.description: Explorer - This impressive double fronted 6 bedroom detached Edwardian villa is in excess of 3000sqft and delightfully situated on Richmond Road, a prestigious road within the South View Conservation area.The current vendor has retained all the traditional features associated with such a period property, whilst integrating a modern contemporary feel perfect for the modern day family. This is evident within the well appointed luxury refitted kitchen/breakfast space which is most definitely the social hub of this stunning home. The property is naturally spacious and versatile throughout, offering a whopping 6 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, and 4 reception rooms within its 3000spft. Externally to the front there is off road driveway parking for several vehicles, externally to the rear there is a private and well maintained garden offering a good degree of privacy. Nb. The property was used as a private residential care home between 1983 and 2011.Richmond Road is a prestigious residential road within the South View conservation area, and located to the north of Basingstoke town centre within a short walk of both the mainline railway station and the Festival Place shopping centre. Basingstoke offers a comprehensive range of leisure, recreational and educational facilities. There is excellent access for commuting to London with the mainline railway station offering fast and frequent services to London Waterloo, and junction 6 of the M3 is within a short drive of the property.
listing.short_description:
Explorer - This impressive double fronted 6 bedroom detached Edwardian villa is in excess of 3000sqft and delightfully situated on Richmond Road, a prestigious road within the South View Conservation area.

The current vendor has retained all the traditional features associated with such a period property, whilst integrating a modern contemporary feel perfect for the modern day family. This is evident within the well appointed luxury refitted kitchen/breakfast space which is most definitely the social hub of this stunning home. The property is naturally spacious and versatile throughout, offering a whopping 6 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, and 4 reception rooms within its 3000spft. Externally to the front there is off road driveway parking for several vehicles, externally to the rear there is a private and well maintained garden offering a good degree of privacy. Nb. The property was used as a private residential care home between 1983 and 2011. Richmond Road is a prestigious residential road within the South View conservation area, and located to the north of Basingstoke town centre within a short walk of both the mainline railway station and the Festival Place shopping centre. Basingstoke offers a comprehensive range of leisure, recreational and educational facilities. There is excellent access for commuting to London with the mainline railway station offering fast and frequent services to London Waterloo, and junction 6 of the M3 is within a short drive of the property.

listing.description: A truly magnificent detached family home. White & Russell are pleased to bring to the market this substantial five bedroom detached family home which is positioned within a popular residential road in kempshott. Beautifully presented throughout and offering nearly 3,000 square feet of accommodation which includes a Master bedroom with walk-in wardrobe and delightful en-suite wet room. There is a guest bedroom with en-suite shower room, 3 further generous bedrooms with an enormous 4-piece family bathroom, all coming off a spectacular galleried landing. The ground floor certainly does not disappoint, where the front door opens into a beautiful reception hall which allows direct access to the double aspect living room, study, cloakroom/wc and into the delightful open plan fitted kitchen/breakfast room & family room with bi-folding doors onto the rear garden and of course a spacious playroom. Benefits include gas fired central heating with full wet system under floor heating to the whole ground floor, double glazed throughout, pretty & generous private rear garden with large raised paved patio and deep frontage which provides off street parking for many vehicles. Truly a wonderful family home that can only be fully appreciated with an internal viewing.
listing.short_description: A truly magnificent detached family home. White & Russell are pleased to bring to the market this substantial five bedroom detached family home which is positioned within a popular residential road in kempshott. Beautifully presented throughout and offering nearly 3,000 square feet of accomm (cont.)

listing.description: Randalls Residential Estate Agents. A delightful 5 bed detached 'Musselwhite' family home standing in mature private gardens with a double garage and gated driveway.Reception hall, sitting room, conservatory, study, kitchen/ dining room, cloakroom, utility room, master bedroom with en suite bathroom room, guest bedroom with en suite shower room, three further bedrooms, family bathroom, gardens, double garage. EPC Band DM3 J6 1 mileLondon Waterloo from 45 minutesSituationThe property is situated in Skippetts Lane East, one of the more prestigious roads within Basingstoke, located to the south of the town but within walking distance of Queen Mary's College, the Festival Place shopping centre and the mainline railway station.Basingstoke offers a comprehensive range of leisure, recreational and educational facilities. There is good access for commuting with the M3 being a short distance away, and the mainline railway station in Basingstoke provides fast and frequent services to London Waterloo.The propertyBuild during the 1930’s by renowned local developer Musselwhites, Merrymeet is a substantial and individual detached family home standing in private mature gardens. It has been carefully maintained and modernised by the current owners and now offers comfortable and well-presented accommodation and still retains the character and charm of its heritage.On the ground floor, the front door opens to the reception hall from which the staircase rises to the first floor, with cloakroom off. The spacious dual aspect sitting room has a bay window with French doors overlooking the garden, parquet flooring and an open fireplace, and a door leads to the adjoining dual aspect study/dining room. The kitchen/dining room is comprehensively fitted with an extensive range of units with ample worksurfaces and fitted appliances and overlooks the private rear terrace. Double doors open to the double-glazed conservatory from which French doors open to the garden. There is also a large utility room.On the first floor the spacious master bedroom has an en suite shower room, and there are three further bedrooms and the family bathroom.On the second floor is the spacious guest bedroom, also with an en suite shower room.For further details please refer to the floorplan.OutsideThe property is approached from the lane over a gated gravel driveway which provides parking in front of the two garages.The garden is enclosed by mature hedging and offers a high degree of privacy. Laid primarily to lawn, with a number of mature trees and bushes, the garden lies primarily to the front of the house with paved terrace outside the sitting room and a further and sheltered paved terrace to the rearServicesAll mains services are connectedLocal authorityBasingstoke and Deane Borough CouncilViewingBy prior appointment through Randalls Residential on Directions to RG21 3ATFrom the central one-way system in New Road in the centre of town, follow the signs to Alton on the Hackwood Road. Proceed straight over the first (Hackwood) roundabout, and at the next (Venture) roundabout take the third exit into Grove Road. After a short distance take the left hand turning into the Skippetts Lane East slip road, and, at the end, turn left into Skippetts Lane East proper and Merrymeet is the first house on the left hand side.
listing.short_description: Randalls Residential Estate Agents. A delightful 5 bed detached 'Musselwhite' family home standing in mature private gardens with a double garage and gated driveway.

listing.description: Charlton Grace are delighted to present to the market, for the first time since it was built 35 years ago, this substantial individual well-presented executive detached house, positioned in a fine plot of just under a quarter of an acre, at the head of arguably the finest development in Basingstoke.DescriptionCharlton Grace are delighted to present to the market, for the first time since it was built 35 years ago, this substantial individual well-presented executive detached house, positioned in a fine plot of just under a quarter of an acre, at the head of arguably the finest development in Basingstoke. The property has a ground floor comprising a reception hallway, cloakroom, double aspect living room, dining room, kitchen with granite work tops, breakfast room and utility room. The first floor has a master bedroom with large en-suite bathroom, four further bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is a driveway leading to a double garage, and a large well maintained west facing rear garden.LocationBuilt in 1986, Walnut Lodge is one of the few original properties that formed the highly prestigious Cliddesden Court development. It is located about a mile to the south of the centre, which has a thriving cosmopolitan centre and regular mainline railway service to London Waterloo (about 45 minutes). Importantly the town offers schooling for all age groups and the house is within a short walk of Queen Marys Further Education College and the adjoining playing fields. Basingstoke has an excellent range of leisure facilities including a sports centre, cinema, theatre, range of restaurants and public houses, as well as various leisure and retail options within Festival Place shopping mall. The M3 motorway (Junc. 6) is within a short drive providing access to London and the south coast.Ground floorEntrance porch. Door to:Reception hallway. Stairs to first floor with cupboard under, radiator.Downstairs cloakroom. Front aspect. Comprising wash basin and low-level WC, radiator.Living room. 24'0" x 14'0" (7.32m x 4.27m) Double aspect with French doors to the rear garden. Fireplace with real flame gas fire, wood surround and mantle. TV points, two radiators, wall lights.Dining room. 13'9" x 12'0" (4.19m x 3.66m) Rear aspect. Radiator.Study. 11'9" x 7'6" (3.58m x 2.29m) Front aspect. Radiator.Kitchen. 12'0" x 12'0" (3.66m x 3.66m) Rear aspect. Fitted with a quality range of oak units at floor and eye level with matching drawers, granite work surfaces and tiled backs. Single drainer one and a half bowl sink unit with mixer tap, brushed steel double oven with ceramic hob and extractor hood over, plumbing for dishwasher. Tiled flooring, recessed lighting. Open access to:Breakfast room. 10'0" x 9'0" (3.05m x 2.74m) Front aspect. Radiator, continuation of tiled flooring from kitchen.Utility room. 9'0" x 9'0" (2.74m x 2.74m) Rear aspect. Fitted units at base level with work surfaces. Sink unit with mixer tap. Plumbing for washing machine and tumble dryer. Quarry tiled flooring, gas boiler, door to double garage.First floorLanding. Front aspect. Hatch to loft space, airing cupboard.Master bedroom. 14'0" x 12'0" (4.27m x 3.66m) Front aspect. Two built in double wardrobes, radiator, door to:En-suite. Rear aspect. Corner bath with mixer tap, shower enclosure, low-level WC, bidet, pedestal wash basin with mixer tap, chrome towel radiator.Bedroom two. 12'0" x 12'0" (3.66m x 3.66m) Rear aspect. Radiator, built in double wardrobe.Bedroom three. 14'0" x 9'9" (4.27m x 2.97m) Front aspect. Built in double wardrobe, radiator.Bedroom four. 10'0" x 10'0" (3.05m x 3.05m) Rear aspect. Radiator, built in double wardrobe, vanity recess with basin.Bedroom five. 12'6" x 7'6" (3.81m x 2.29m) Front aspect. Radiator, built in double wardrobe.Family bathroom. Rear aspect. Bath with mixer tap, low-level WC, pedestal wash basin with mixer tap, shower enclosure, part tiled walls, towel radiator.OutsideThe property stands in a plot of 0.24 of an acre.Front garden. Shingle driveway with turning space leading to the double garage. Neat level lawn, well stocked beds and border to the front boundary with brick retained wall. Side access gate to:Rear garden. Immaculately manicured and enjoying a private west facing aspect with paved patio adjoining the rear of the house, steps rising to an expanse of well tended lawn complimented by well stocked beds and borders.Double garage. 19'3" x 19'0" (5.87m x 5.79m) Two roller doors, power and light, pitched roof, door to utility room.
listing.short_description: Charlton Grace are delighted to present to the market, for the first time since it was built 35 years ago, this substantial individual well-presented executive detached house, positioned in a fine plot of just under a quarter of an acre, at the head of arguably the finest development in Basingstoke.
